results.title: Turning point: rescue of a river
results.brief_description: History of citizen action for the protection of the Wilamet River in Oregon, U.S.A., and the current program - Project Foresight - for the preservation of open space and the limiting of urban sprawl so that both the Wilamet Valley and the Wilamet River remain free of cumulating industrial wastes and continue to be agriculturally fertile and productive

results.title: Turning point
results.brief_description: 1970 and world population below the age of fifteen has almost reached 1500 million. Of these, only one out of four gets any primary education, and less than one out of twelve achieves secondary schooling. What can be done to bridge the gap of ignorance, and prevent more millions from joining the ranks of the uneducated? Made for International Education Year.

results.title: Turning
results.brief_description: Looks at Anatolia and its part in the evolution of Caucasian civilization, in particular that of modern Middle Eastern religious thought. The Dervishes and their ancient dance rituals are studied in some detail.

results.title: Turned round to see
results.creator_credit: Franciscan Communications Center, Karl Holtsnider and Nicholas Frangakis
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about the experiences of a lonely and puzzled 17-year-old boy who wanders into a teenage discotheque. Expresses the need for self knowledge and that such self knowledge leads an individual to reach out to others.

results.title: Turn the soil
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and John Heyer
results.brief_description: This film traces the story of the development of the Australian wheat industry from the days when the first Ridley machine was taken into the crops at harvest time. It shows what scientific research and experimentation are doing today to help the wheat farmer combat rust, low rainfall, wind, weeds, and other pests, and to develop strains of wheat which mature well in spite of adverse climactic conditions.

results.title: Turn of the tide. The Man at the gate
results.creator_credit: British National Films GHW Productions, John Corfield, J. Arthur Rank, Lady Yule and Norman Walker
results.brief_description: Turn of the tide (80 min): This rarely seen British film, based on the novel ‘Three fevers’ by Leo Walmsley, was filmed on location at Robin Hood’s Bay and Whitby and tells the story of rivalry between two fishing families. It is set in the dramatically beautiful countryside of the Yorkshire coast. “The Man at the gate” (48 min): In 1940 Norman Walker put on his sea boots yet again and sent his location team down to Cornwall to shoot exteriors for a film which might have been regarded as a sequel. The story is centred around a fishing family, headed by Wilfrid Lawson.

results.title: Turn of the century
results.brief_description: A glance at Canada’s yesteryears, at people and events, fashions and foibles at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th. From old photos and fragments of silent movies, this film pieces together a lively chronicle of what our elders like to call “the good old days.”

results.title: Turn a handle, flick a switch. - 2nd rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Shows how basic domestic services, such as gas, electricity and water are provided. Deals with the source of these services, their reticulation and home usage. The program ends with a strong conservation message - “turn off the light, etc.” Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
